name: Becca's Potato Bacon Soup
author: Reebs
summary: This creamy potato soup is good any time of the year, but especially in cold weather months. It reheats well and can be made without bacon or cheese. This is filling enough to be served as a main dish, but also makes a nice side soup if served in smaller portions. Feel free to add your own ingredients: other vegetables, seasonings, different cheeses, etc. When serving, some options for garnish are chopped green onions, additional crumbled bacon, shredded cheese, and parsley. Enjoy!
ingredients: 6 slices cooked bacon, crumbled, or more to taste
4 cups chicken broth, or more as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
4 slices American cheese, cut into small pieces
directions: Place cooked bacon in a large stockpot over medium-high heat; add potatoes, chicken broth, carrots, onion, parsley, celery seed, salt, and pepper
Bring mixture to a boil, cover stockpot with a lid, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring frequently and slightly mashing potatoes, until potatoes are fully cooked, at least 20 minutes
Add extra chicken broth if needed
Whisk milk and flour together in a bowl or measuring cup until frothy; slowly pour into soup while constantly stirring
Bring soup back to a simmer and cook until soup is thickened, 3 to 5 minutes
Remove soup from heat and stir in American cheese until completely melted
Ladle soup into serving bowls and garnish with green onions
